Reviews.Title: “Conventional Overnight Hotel that You Might Find Along A Freeway”
Reviews.Author: Zoom_Gotti
Reviews.Content: Two storey motel between the 101 and 118 on Desoto in the SF Valley. Note that at busy hours it can take some time to access either freeway. This motel is located a few minutes drive to two large shopping centers, but this particular street corner offers no real amenities. However, I had a large room with both a microwave and small fridge. I found several supermarkets nearby where I could buy groceries so I wouldn't have to drive miles trying to find an adequate restaurant. My room was sufficiently cleaned each day and had a large flat screen TV. I asked about a complimentary newspaper in the morning and the desk clerk told me that they stopped getting them because nobody bothered to read them. In my room, the message light on my phone wouldn't go off, until a higher ranking reservations clerk came in the next day to fix it. I also couldn't figure out how to re-set the room clock, so I used the one on the microwave. There's a bus stop on the corner from where you can actually get to Hollywood or downtown LA (or anywhere you can transfer to), but it will take quite some time. But if your reason for being here is to stay up here in the valley, then this would be a reasonably inexpensive lodging to use for a few days. Just don't expect too much in the way of extra comfort. And you might want to bypass this place if you're driving a trailer because there's really not suffcient space for parking large vehicles. However, I found the staff to be personable and helpful if you are cordial to them. They returned my driver's license to me the next morning after I inadvertently left it at the front desk the evening of my check-in.

Reviews.Title: “big disappoint. be aware - 24 hrs notice is a money trap”
Reviews.Author: Steve N
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room for two nights with specific requests to be away from noises like elevator and ice maker because I am light sleeper. at the time of check-in, I requested to stay away from the main street and asked for the room further inside because I am light sleeper. the manager of the hotel told me that he was aware of my advance requirements which I stated during online booking but he told me the only room #201 left which is next to the street. I told him I cannot take it since I requested for no noise room. he told me the room has no window facing the street; therefore, it has no noise. it won't bother me so give it a try. I cannot cancel because the policy requires 24 hrs notice else I lose 1 night but this hotel knowingly sold me something I did not want. Needless to say, I can't sleep the whole night because cars and trucks drove by all night long so I packed up and left next morning. I asked for my refund because I was deceived and lied to but the clerk would not return my money and not refund the second night either despite the fact that I did not stay the second night. the clerk then offered me another room in the back but I declined due to annoying deceptive practices. the clerk kept on insisting 24 hrs notice requirement but unable to provide me the answer of why he provided me a reservation when he knew his hotel has no intention to meet my requirement. I also told the clerk that i would never stay at Ramada had I know I would be in a room that is next to the street. the internet in the room didn't work either. I called the front desk 3 times and was told I am on my own so call up the 800 numbers for support. the bed spread smell strong odor of chemical which I was allergic too. the morning clerk also told me that he needs a 24 hrs notice to cancel the second night. I told him I was deceived into a product I did not want to buy and my reservation should never took place since his facility was not able to meet my requirements for the room. I feel that the system was setup to entrap customers and took customers money without properly services. I am disappointed that Ramada brand went that far to entrap customers just to steal their moneys with the 24 hrs notice trap.

Reviews.Title: “Melbourne, Australia”
Reviews.Author: Denise K
Reviews.Content: Great value. Great location. The staff was very friendly, helpful and always on hand. Stayed in New Orleans (Ambassador), Austin (Hilton) and then the Ramada Canoga Park and this was the best of the three. The rooms was clean and the bed great. Great restaurants nearby, only a 10 minute walk to the Metrol Express Bus and another 5 minutes to Westfield. Will stay here on our next visit to the US. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “family reunion”
Reviews.Author: karen s
Reviews.Content: We all met up here for a family reunion because the rates are affordable for a very large group of people!! the rooms are very roomy and clean. The rooms have large beds and a beautiful pool. The continential breakfast is wonderful and it helped alot. Thank you Ramada for a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff makes the stay pleasant”
Reviews.Author: StrawberrySunshine
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, modern decor, free parking. But the polite helpful staff (or family members) in the office are the nicest part of this Ramada. A young guy at the desk held the door for me while my hands were full, asked what else we needed, and was just way more service oriented than other places we have stayed around this area. Rooms aren't silent, but much quieter than other places in this busy area. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on Business, great for the money, lot of european travelers stay here, The parking is free and there is plenty. The front desk and staff have been here for years, that says a lot for any hotel!! Takes about a half an hour to burbank or beverly hills depending on traffic. Have Fun

Reviews.Title: “low rates!!”
Reviews.Author: gail h
Reviews.Content: Friendly guest service, clean rooms comfortable beds, the rates were just what we were looking for espically for a family of 5!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a great price”
Reviews.Author: dinhtuyen
Reviews.Content: Price is low. The room is clean and better I expected. Worth for your money.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: jodi p
Reviews.Content: Clean and friendly hotel. AFFORDABLE!!! and a nice area to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, recently remodeled, and in room jacuzzis!”
Reviews.Author: torresongs
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was on the first floor which is usually not my preference. The place is built in the old motel style where anyone off the street could walk right up to your door. But room was so pleasant. It was obviously recently remodeled and was quite roomy. The in-room jacuzzi was huge and quite a novelty. The bed was clean, large and very comfortable. The room also included a separate stall shower and large vanity area. The was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The place was extremely quiet for a Saturday night. Total for one night came to about $150.

Reviews.Title: “dirty carpets, room smells bad, old”
Reviews.Author: travel8956
Reviews.Content: The carpets of the room have dirty black stains; it smells bad probably due to old dirty carpet. The continental breakfast room smells bad because of the incense and the smell penetrates to the food that are in the breakfast room. The front desk person service is not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Roomy and clean!”
Reviews.Author: ChatsworthLovedIt
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved it here! You can always judge the personnel by the manager when staying in a hotel...at least that's the experience I've had in the past. If the Manager is unfriendly with a frown more than likely the staff will be the same. Here at the Ramada, the Manager was friendly and kind as well as the staff. The property and room was always clean and orderly and the coffee is good. I felt safe being here and if there were a small kitchenette, I would probably make it my home, and the free WIFI actually works!!!! Best place and I would absolutely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 2011Zoe
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again when I'm in need of a hotel in the area. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, the beds and pillows were the most comfortable I've slept on in a hotel in a long time, and the toiletries were wonderful. Can't say enough about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - close to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a rich breakfast and an amazing value for money. Conveniently located close to Universal Studios, Hollywood, NBC Studios.. Rooms are OK, but nothing extraordinary; as far as they are clean it's fine with me..

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure - Great Value for the Lowest Price”
Reviews.Author: ksonline
Reviews.Content: I just needed a room for a one night stay, and I started checking the usual low cost motel options. After reading some good reviews, I chose this Ramada. It turned out to be as nice a room as I have had in many hotel stays. The room even includes a refrigerator and microwave, coffee, and free microwave. I even got a newspaper in the morning. The whole operation is first class, and less expensive than any other hotel in the area. An excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay February thru March 2011”
Reviews.Author: babygirl002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I was been staying at this hotel since February do to our condo being repaired and probably wonâ€™t be checking out until March 15th or so. We have been treated extremely well with no issues with any staff members at all. Everyone here is nice and here to help you as needed. Every room weâ€™ve have been in have been really clean with everything mentioned on the website. I would gladly recommend this hotel to my friends and family. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience of my life.”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm211
Reviews.Content: These people are liars, cheats, and frankly quite disgusting in all possible ways. I stayed there one night. The Internet did not work in the room, but they denied the reality, basically called me a liar, refused to change the room, left me out in the cold all day and then refused to give me credit for the other 2 nights I had paid before. Buyer beware--don't go near this place unless you want to be screamed at, abused and then finally ripped off for $150. May they rot in hell.

Reviews.Title: “nice very clean motel”
Reviews.Author: hakanarikan
Reviews.Content: Ramada Canoga Park was a very nice, very clean motel with spacious, quiet rooms, very friendly staff. Safe free parking, free internet. We had a a very comfortable 10 day stay. Will definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mariosena
Reviews.Content: very nice place weith incredible staff for sure will be back again in thre near future

Reviews.Title: “Reception”
Reviews.Author: iceman805
Reviews.Content: Great service! Helped a bunch. Gave me all the information I needed to complete my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed 5 nights here and was...”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights here and was delighted with the service, rooms and value for money. It's in a good location, about 5 minutes to the 101 Ventura freeway, and handy for those exploring LA.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KBR_ABQ_NM
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business with meetings in L.A., Port Hueneme, and even San Diego, so the central location was quite convenient for me. The staff was very friendly and considerate, opening the breakfast room early for me since I had to leave before the official opening time. They also were kind enough to print out my boarding pass, which saved me considerable time on a rush trip back to the airport. The rooms are clean and comfortable, newly remodeled, with any of the amenities you would want, including free internet and continental breakfast. My room was very quiet and I had no problem sleeping. The beds were very comfortable. The neighborhood did not seem the greatest, but since I was simply using the hotel for sleeping and catching up on work, this did not bother me. The other hotel guests were also friendly, and I did not feel "unsafe" at any point. This hotel offered good value, and I would recommend for someone who needs a clean, cheap, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enter on your own risk.”
Reviews.Author: GRATHOD
Reviews.Content: These guys messed up with the card payment. For the the corporate card, which was used to make the payments at various other hotels before and after this stay, they said it is not working and they charged all the amount to my personal card which they had taken for incidentals. The worst part is I was not even informed about this, even though they had my number with them. I was left with almost no cash for myself. When I contacted them, they refused to credit back the amount. It's sad.

Reviews.Title: “FORGET ABOUT THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Herman34
Reviews.Content: From the moment you check in there is certainly a sense of insecurity throughout this property. The so called " manager" (who apparently is there day and night) treats everybody like if he is doing them a favor. Not only theyy would argue with you but they are even fisty. Too many issues to describe during a two day stay so no use.Cancel your reservation if you have one, you will save a pityful experience .Hopefully Ramada officials take note of what guests are saying here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: R0adWarri0r4Life
Reviews.Content: From the moment we tried to check in after a late arrival to trying to get a room key for my spouse this was the worst hotel I have experienced in my career. The manager actually yelled at me and called me a curse word. I work for a large consulting firm and travel over 150 nights a year - please do not stay at this hotel. Words cannot describe my experience.. It was awful - my cab had to wait 30 min for someone to open the door to let me in .. it just was down hill from there.

Reviews.Title: “Crackeling noises all night”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: Ramada Canoga Park I have got this motel through Hotwire with a good rate. It is far on the north end from Los Angeles, in fact we had when coming from Santa Monica to cross mountains by using one of the canyons. It was a very nice drive though...The good thing that it is so far from LA town and busy districts â€“ itâ€™s a much more quiet area. Some latino shops and restaurants are adjacent and in walking distance. This Ramada is a low standard one, no AAA stars at all. It is built in typical motel style surrounding a courtyard that is used as parking lot. I did not see a pool somewhere or many plants or flowers. There was no traffic noise from street during night, though it was a busy and broad street. What kept us awake all night was crackeling noise from the ceiling (as well in our as in our friends room that was a farther away). If you go there â€“ avoid 2nd floor, probably on 1st there is not so much crackeling noises. Waterpipes in bathrooms - even in adjacent ones - worked noisy as well, you might not hear much from your neighbours except them using water. There was no coffeemaker in room but a fridge and microwave. We had got a King room, with the usual 2 beds, matrasses ok, tiny table and chair, TV. Room equipment was standard. Rooms were clean. No wireless internet. In the morning you can get breakfast in a small room adjacent to the tiny lobby. We did not use it. Staff was emotionless, so not really friendly. A place that is ok for one night especially for the price but certainly I would not go back because of the crackeling noises in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: My room was nice, but there was so much street noise. It was almost like being next to a freeway and the windows should be double-paned here. Heavy trucks pass by frequently. The rooms have apparently been redecorated and they don't look bad, but they left in place the awful cottage chese ceiling from the 1970s. It's a step up from a typical Motel 6. The room had a microwave oven, fridge, iron, coffee maker, hair dryer and a safe. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. There is an off-brand flat-screen TV mounted on the wall, but it takes about a minute to see the picture after you turn it on. There were only a handful of channels. Breakfast could be skipped, unless you are desperate. They only have bread, a toaster, icky-sweet prepackaged pastries, and apples, juice & coffee. It would have been nice to have bagels or oatmeal or something healthier. This isn't a bad place, but I probably wouldn't stay here again, mostly because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away; Book a room for a little more somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: sam_ua
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at the Ramada Canoga Park 11/26/08 to 11/30/08 to enjoy some of the attractions LA has to offer. When we arrived at the hotel we were slightly early as we gained a hour due to entering a different time zone. We entered the lobby of the hotel and were greeted (if that's what you call it) by the front desk person (who appears to live on the premises). He said we were too early, and to come back in 1.5 hours (yet there were 2 vehicles parked in the parking lot, and what appeared to be many vacant hotel rooms). Read on - it gets way better! We drove to a nearby mall to waste some time, and returned to the hotel to check in. I inquired about a room upgrade, and was told that because we booked on Orbitz, a room upgrade would be very costly. It was quite clear that since we didn't book the room through the hotel, they wanted nothing to do with us. We gave a credit card for the "incidentals" and were handed the room key, but were not directed to where the room was - we were not even informed about where and when breakfast was served. Upon entering the room, we were greeted with a King Size bed with 3 heavily worn pillows, linens that smelt old, a LCD television manufactured by Astar (never heard of them), and a bathroom which was quite evident of severe water damage. The bathroom had grout between the tile that appeared to be tinted green by the water (like the green on a leaky copper water pipe), mold in the grout in the shower, was missing floor molding (no pun intended), and the wallpaper was peeling in multiple locations. Sure there was granite countertops, but it was evident they skimped on the "remodel" and just tried to get the best bang for their buck! Departing from the bathroom, the main hotel room wasn't much better. There was still the peeling wall paper, but there were also holes in the ceiling which had been patched very poorly. These holes were the size of a softball, and looked like a 3 year old tried to patch them with silly putty. Next to one of the holes, there was what appeared to be blood spatter, or some sort of red spots (which were consequently above the smelly bed). There were holes that had been poorly patched in the walls, which then had wallpaper slapped over them in an attempt to hide them. We attempted to operate the television with the remote, but the channel buttons didn't actually control the channels! We placed a call to the front desk, and were told to use the white buttons on the remote (and were given attitude which seemed like we were bothering them). Moving on to breakfast, or lack thereof. I knew there was a continental breakfast, and most hotels I stay at offer a few choices, of bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, etc. The breakfast area in this hotel consisted of 3 tables (all with granite counters) but smelt of urine. The room was about 10'x12' and had your choice of 2 cereals, white or wheat bread, a very limited selection of individually wrapped danish, orange juice, and coffee. They didn't keep the danash stocked, so I was limited to toast with grape jelly or cereal. The hotel is too far from Hollywood to be picked up by a tour bus and parking near the Walk of Fame was terrible. Universal Studios was a 20 minute trip away, and there was no wait on Thanksgiving Day for any of the rides. All in all, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and should I return to LA, I will stick with the hotels I regularly use for work which do not include the Ramada Chain. I hope you will find this review useful when considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianyHongKong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights (Aug 07 - 10). I think this is a rather new hotel. The room facilities are new and adequate. Even better is that it offers free wi-fi access. I came across several hotels. Normally I would be charged for US$13 per day. Hence, it was a surprise for free. It also offers free continental breakfast. It is not located in downtown, but if you have a car, the ride is not that long. It took me about 30 minutes to Universal Studios, Hollywood and Santa Monica beach. It is just in the middle of these tourist attractions. Before I booked this hotel, I found it new, and the price is competitive. After my stay here, I think I have made a right decision.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible unsafe location Rude management”
Reviews.Author: yshe
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experiance. Management lie. Very unsafe area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: LauraandPhoebe
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, very clean. I have an issue with the $4.95 extra charge for the internet and safe that I didn't use. It should be built into the room price, not added on to the price as an extra charge. All rooms face the parking lot, so you hear the Beep Beep of cars locking. The curtains kept the room dark when pulled, so that was a plus when I wanted to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: midlandtourist
Reviews.Content: We booked for four days. We were spending the days doing tourist activities so we wanted an economical room within a reasonable driving distance to LA. We had been staying in Los Angeles, in a Starwood hotel and expected this place to be a step down. We were wrong. The parking lot, lobby, all public areas are well cared for. The room was large and comfortable and very, very clean. Nicely decorated, furniture looked new, no stains on the carpet, a small microwave, fridge and a large flat screen LCD TV. Staff was courteous. Management was very helpful with suggestions for restaurants. We cannot comment on the continental breakfast as we try to stay away from carbs so we did not bother to drop in. A sign at the front desk and on the internet site listed that there would be a charge for the safe and the internet but it was included in our rate. The hotel is not located in a tourist area. The area is more industrial and a bit run down and is not that appealing for walking around but within ten minutes there is a huge new mall. One needs a car. But the freeways are nearby. This was a good experience and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges, charge for internet even though advertised as free”
Reviews.Author: jettaman71
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with our stay except for a view problems. The first problem was out 3rd night when someone's car alarm kept going off. It must of went off 4 times after 10pm and lasted 1 minutes each time. I called and complained to the front desk and after about 2 hours they dicovered that someone from the nearby Motel 6 had parked their car in the Ramada lot because they thought that it would be safer. My other complaint is the fact that there are hidden charges on the bill. My wife and I left without reviewing the bill. Once we were able to look at it I discovered that they charges us $1.75 a day for the in room safe and $2.50 for telecom charges. They charge you this every day that you stay. We had booked through Ramada.com and we're told about these hidden charges. I called the Hotel and got no where with them and then called Ramada's 1-800 number. They filed a case number and said that the hotel's owner would get a fax and call me about the complaint. I think that they should be up front about these charges. The web site advertises free wireless internet in the rooms and I was under the impression that if you don't use the phone that they don't charge you for it. Hiding all of these charges is how they can show a lower rate per night.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: longwayaround
Reviews.Content: Garbage stacked up and blowing around in parking lot. Emergency vehicles driving by at all hours. Toilet runs all night. No remote for tv. Breakfast is a joke. Nothing hot (no eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal), no fruit other than bruised apples, no yogurt. Service is terrible. Room not cleaned at all one day. On other days was cleaned late in the day (5-6 pm) which doesn't help in the morning when you don't have clean towels, garbage is not collected and bed is not made up all day. Brought this to the attention of the front desk and left voice and emails to the manager. Manager did not respond at all during the entire stay (5 nights). If this had not been a prepaid reservation I would have left much sooner. Would not wish a stay at this property on my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good enough, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days for business and it is do-able. The lobby wreaks of curry, like an Indian home, which was a little jarring, until you meet the staff. They were pleasant enough. The breakfast area is right off the lobby so you can pick up your USA Today and get your food. They have a sign saying you can't take the food out of the room, but that was never a problem for me. The room was spacious enough and even had a comfy couch and a coffee table. There is a safe, a refrigerator, a microwave, and a coffee maker, which was a surprise considering they serve coffee in the breakfast area. The parking and the wireless internet are free, both points being the reason I picked this place. The hotel is a little strange in that they were apparently renovating at the time, so some of the rooms were eerily empty. The room seemed clean. I stayed in six hotels on this business trip and this was my third favorite, if that means anything. All in all, this place fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze when I arrived at 1:00am. When I walked into my room I was pleasantly surprised. The room apeared newly decorated and very clean. To my amazement there was a small refridgerator, microwave, coffee maker, and wall safe for valuables. This is hard to find even in more expensive hotels. There was also an ironing board, iron, and hair dryer. Needless to say, I highly recommend this small motel located convienently located in Canoga Park which was minutes away from Reseda where I was visiting my brother.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhelpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at the Ramada Limited Canoga Park this summer (2004). The year before, we phoned and were given a good, clean, obviously renovated room, and had an enjoyable stay. This year, however, we booked the room online, and when we got there we discovered that they reserve only a few small rooms for online bookings. These rooms tend to be in the corner of the building and therefore dimmer than others. When we requested another room, the front desk did so reluctantly and told us we would be charged more. The room they moved us to did not have a functioning safety deposit box, and the front desk manager said he could not do anything about this. The most common response the front desk had for any of our requests was that he could not do anything about it. Thus, after 2 nights, we moved to the Best Western Motor Inn down the road, which we think is the best place in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: khan
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Ramada Inn that we have ever stayed at. We asked for a non-smoking room, and instead got a room that smelled full of smoke. The bathroom was not cleaned properly and they had the coffee maker and drinking glasses in the bathroom, which is veryun-hygenic (we did not touch any of it). The person at the front desk changed our room, which was a little better for the most part. The traffic at night was terrible and kept us awake throughout the night.I pointed out some of the issues at check-out time, and they did not seem very helpfull. The phone kept on ringing all night for no apparent reason. We were charged $90.00, and it was DEFINITELY not worth it. I will never stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Limited Canoga Park/Warner Center
